page.title: 12SPONSORED WALKS, BEDGEBURY
page.content: One form of fund-raising for charity or self-help is the sponsored event. This is usually a walk, for which the walkers seek "sponsorships" of a few pence per mile walked, but may also be a horse or cycle ride, run, swim, etc. Bedgebury is a particularly suitable area for sponsored walks and rides, having many public rights of way, both footpaths and bridleways, including several through the Forest. Bedgebury School and others have held local sponsored walks or rides for such charities as Guide Dogs for the Blind, Kent Orphans, Riding for the Disabled, World Wildlife and Cancer Research, and also for their own amenities such as a chapel organ. These events combine exercise, pleasure and charity but need careful organisation; the police and Ramblers' Association can give helpful advice.
